comments.body: this looks off.  We use thsi somewhere?
Yeah, it is used in this command here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubectl/cmd/config/get_contexts.go#L136
Why doesn't this use the new printflags you just made?

Did not use them here since the command does not use regular printers, only fmt.Fprintf statements [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubectl/cmd/config/get_contexts.go#L154) and [here](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubectl/cmd/config/get_contexts.go#L163)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +89,93 @@	}

	cmd.Flags().Bool("no-headers", false, "When using the default or custom-column output format, don't print headers (default print headers).")
	cmd.Flags().StringP("output", "o", "", "Output format. One of: name")
	return cmd
